options.-b:
issue warnings about str(bytes_instance), str(bytearray_instance)and comparing bytes/bytearray with str. 
(-bb: issue errors)
options.-B\u200B:
don't write .pyc files on import;
also PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=x
options.-c:
cmd
program passed in as string (terminates option list)
options.-d:
turn on parser debugging output (for experts only, only works on debug builds);
also PYTHONDEBUG=x
options.-E: ignore PYTHON* environment variables (such as PYTHONPATH)
options.-I\u200B: isolate Python from the user's environment (implies -E and -s)
options.-m:
mod
run library module as a script (terminates option list)
options.-O:
remove assert and __debug__-dependent statements;
add .opt-1 before .pyc extension; also PYTHONOPTIMIZE=x
options.-OO:
do -O changes and also discard docstrings;
add .opt-2 before .pyc extension
options.-P: don't prepend a potentially unsafe path to sys.path
options.-q: don't print version and copyright messages on interactive startup
options.-s: don't add user site directory to sys.path; also PYTHONNOUSERSITE
options.-u:
force the stdout and stderr streams to be unbuffered
this option has no effect on stdin; also PYTHONUNBUFFERED=x
options.-v:
verbose (trace import statements)
also PYTHONVERBOSE=x can be supplied multiple times to increase verbosity
options.-V\u200B:
--version
print the Python version number and exit
when given twice, print more information about the build
options.-x: skip first line of source, allowing use of non-Unix forms of #!cmd
options.--check-hash-based-pycs: control how Python invalidates hash-based .pyc files
options.--help-env: print help about Python environment variables and exit
options.--help-xoptions: print help about implementation-specific -X options and exit
options.--help-all: print complete help information and exit
options.--h: print this help message and exit (also -? or --help)
